direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods process input strings and return a result, though 'toString' provides a string representation of the validator itself, while 'validate' processes the input string against the patterns.
Both methods process input strings and return a result, though 'toString' provides a string representation of the validator itself, while 'match' returns matched groups from the input string.

Both methods process input strings and return a result, though 'toString' provides a string representation of the validator itself, while 'isValid' returns a boolean indicating if the input string matches any pattern.
Both methods access the patterns array, though 'toString' uses it to generate a string representation, while 'getPatterns' returns a copy of the patterns.
